title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total revenue of producing 30 units as $210 and/or does not show the work.

Total Revenue=Price×Quantity=$7×30=$210 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5AAA@

The response calculates the total revenue of producing 30 units as $210 and shows the work.

Total Revenue=Price×Quantity=$7×30=$210 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5AAA@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the demand curve is curve is elastic for quantities between 30 and 40 units and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue is positive; or use numbers to explain that total revenue is rising as price goes down in that quantity range, the percentage change in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage change in price, or the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1.

The response states that the demand curve is elastic for quantities between 30 and 40 units and explains that the marginal revenue is positive; or use numbers to explain that total revenue is rising as price goes down in that quantity range, the percentage change in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage change in price, or the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm should increase its price and/or does not explain that at a price of $6, the marginal cost is greater than the marginal revenue or explain that the profit-maximizing price is $7 (from the demand curve for the profit-maximizing quantity where marginal cost is equal to marginal revenue).

The response states that the firm should increase its price and explains that at a price of $6, the marginal cost is greater than the marginal revenue or explains that the profit-maximizing price is $7 (from the demand curve for the profit-maximizing quantity where marginal cost is equal to marginal revenue).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm has diminishing marginal returns and/or does not explain that marginal cost is rising at the quantity of 50 units, indicating that the marginal product is falling.
The response states that the firm has diminishing marginal returns and explains that marginal cost is rising at the quantity of 50 units, indicating that the marginal product is falling.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify that the allocatively efficient quantity is 40 units and/or does not explain that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve.

The response identifies that the allocatively efficient quantity is 40 units and explains that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve.
